III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CPA Rule 400.12320
Section Supervision
Description • (1) An agency shall ensure an appropriate level of care and
supervision for the foster child at all times consistent with a
child's age, level of functioning, and treatment plan.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation It is alleged that workers allowed independent youth to visit where
alleged sex offender lives and they were using drugs.
Investigation The investigation was initiated via telephone on 06/24/2025 with
another DHHS Worker. The investigation will be conducted jointly
with DHHS Worker.
Youth A was interviewed face to face onsite on 06/25/2025.
Youth A is a 16 year old youth who resides in the Holy Cross
Children’s Services independent living program (ILP). Youth A
reported he and Youth B went on a visit to Youth D’s Father’s
(referred to as Father from here on) house. Youth D is a graduate
of the agency independent living program. Youth A thought they
were going to Youth D’s Mother’s (referred to as Relative 1 from
here on) house for the weekend but visited Father’s house. Youth
A reported going on a visit requires that he fill out an agency
independent living visitation form with the address and phone
number of the house he would be visiting and then a staff member
reviews and provides permission for the visit, if appropriate. Youth
A reported he obtained the address and phone number from
Youth D and thought the information was Relative 1’s address and
phone number but it was really the address and phone number of
Father. Youth A reported Youth D manipulated the situation.
Youth A reported once he completed the form he provided it to
Staff 3 for approval. Youth A reported the visit was approved and
he and Youth B were taken to Fathers house. Youth A thought this
was alright because it was the address listed on the visitation
request form and staff had approved the visit. Youth A reported
when they arrived to the home Father and step mother
(information unknown) were there. Youth A reported Staff 2, who
had transported him to the house, came into the house and stayed
for about 20 minutes, and then she left. Youth A reported that he,
Youth B, and Youth D smoked some marijuana which Youth D
had provided. Youth A reported while at the visit Youth B received
a phone call from Staff 1 who informed Youth B that they were not
2

supposed to be at the house as Father is a registered sex
offender. Youth A reported about thirty minutes later he and Youth
B were picked up by Staff 2 and returned to the program.
Youth B was interviewed face to face onsite on 06/25/2025.
Youth B is a 17 year old male who resides at the ILP program.
Youth B reported he had obtained the address for the visit from
Youth D and thought it was the address of Relative 1. Youth B
reported he did not know it was the address of Fathers house.
Youth B reported Staff 2 had taken he and Youth A to Fathers
house and came into the house for a brief period and then left.
Youth B reported they were at the house for about two hours and
were smoking marijuana and drinking alcohol. Youth B reported at
one point he received a telephone call from Staff 1 who said they
were not supposed to be there as Father is a registered sex
offender and staff were coming to pick them up. Youth B reported
Staff 2 returned to the home and picked up he and Youth A and
returned them to the program. Youth B reported Staff 2 apologized
to them as she did not know that Father was a sex offender.
Staff 1 was interviewed face to face onsite on 06/25/25. Staff 1
is a Life Skills Coach at the agency program. Staff 1 reported Staff
3, the agency foster care worker, approves visits for ILP youth and
is supposed to check out the address where a youth requests to
go for a visit. Staff 1 reported on 06/19/2025, the day Youth A and
Youth B were to be begin overnights at Relative 1s house, the
mother, called her to ask a question and in conversation told Staff
1 that Youth D, her son, was not at her house. Staff 1 reported
Relative 1 did not know anything about the scheduled visits of
Youth A and Youth B, along with Youth D, to her house. Staff 1
reported Relative 1 reported Father is a sex offender and Youth D
is staying with him. Staff 1 reported she then called the ILP
Program Manager who stated the youth are not supposed to be at
Father’s house. Staff 1 then called Staff 2 to return to the father’s
house and pick up Youth A and Youth B.
Youth C was interviewed face to face onsite on 06/25/2025.
Youth C is a 16 year old youth who resides at the ILP. Youth C
reported to obtain an overnight visit home pass he has to fill out a
form with the date, time, address and phone number of his
parents. Youth C reported Staff 3, the foster care worker,
approves the visits. Youth C reported staff 3 “checks things out”
before approving a home visit.
Staff 2 was interviewed face to face onsite on 06/25/2025. Staff
2 is an agency foster care worker. Staff 2 reported on 06/19/2025
3

she transported Youth A and Youth B to Father’s house, the
address on the visitation forms. Staff 2 reported she took the word
of Youth D that he and Youth A and Youth B would be staying at
his father’s house and did not question this. Staff 2 reported she
did not verify the approval of what address she was to take the
youth to. Staff 2 reported she had been to the home a few times
and is the worker for Youth D. Staff 2 reported Youth D is 18 years
old and can stay with his father. Staff 2 reported she assumed the
visit with Father was approved but should have taken the initiative
to double check. Staff 2 reported when she dropped Youth A and
Youth B off at the home she went into the house for a while to
verify safety and then left. Staff 2 reported she was on her way
back to Saginaw when she received a text from Staff 3 saying she
should turn around and go pick up Youth A and Youth B as Father
is a sex offender. Staff 2 confirmed she then proceeded to pick up
Youth A and Youth B.
Staff 3 was interviewed face to face on 06/26/2025. Staff 3
reported she approves visits for Youth A and Youth B. Staff 1
reported she called Relative 1 and checked to verify that the
overnight visits for Youth A, Youth B, and Youth D with her were
okay. Staff 3 also reported she cross checked the address on the
visitation forms and verified the address as Relative 1’s. Staff 3
reported she did not know how Youth A and Youth B wound up at
Fathers house. Staff 3 reported she assumed Staff 2 was taking
the youth to Relative 1s house. Staff 3 was asked about the
visitation forms and if a copy could be provided. Staff 3 reported
after visits are completed, the forms are shredded.
Relative 1 was interviewed on 06/26/2025 via telephone.
Relative 1 reported on 06/19/2025 she spoke with Staff 1 and
informed her Father is a registered sex offender. Relative 1
reported she had not been contacted by agency staff in the last
month to have youth stay overnight at her house.
Youth D was interviewed via telephone on 06/26/2025. Youth D
is an 18 year old and is a graduate of the agency program. Youth
D reported when he had talked with Staff 3 several days before
the visit he had stated Youth A and Youth B would be staying at
his father’s house and Staff 3 verbally approved this. Youth D
reported soon after Youth A and Youth B arrived to his father’s
house, Staff 3 called and said that Youth A and Youth B could not
be at his father’s house. Youth D confirmed the address he gave
Youth A and Youth B to put on their visitation form was the
address of his father.
4

Document Review:
• A agency form, titled ‘Transportation Request Form” for
Youth A, also found in the waste basket, lists the address
of Father’s residence which is then crossed out and
Relative 1’s address inserted.
• The Program Manager found the agency “Outing/Late
Curfew/Overnight Request Form” for Youth B in a waste
basket in Staff 3’s office. The request lists the address of
Father.
• Michigan Sex Offender Registry search revealed Father is
listed on the registry.
Analysis Youth A and Youth B filled out the visitation form and listed the
address provided to them by Youth D, assuming it was the
address of Relative 1. Youth A and Youth B reported the visitation
forms were approved by Staff 3.
Staff 3 reported she approved the visitation forms and verified the
address as Relative 1’s. Staff 3 reported she had verified the visit
with Relative 1. Relative 1 denied knowing anything about the
visit. The “Outing/Late Curfew/Overnight Request Form” for Youth
A lists Father’s address. This contradicts Staff 3’s report of
verifying the address as that of Relative 1’s. Relative 1 reported
that she did not speak with Staff 3 about a visit and this
contradicts Staff 1’s report.
Staff 2 did not appropriately verify what address Youth A and
Youth B were to be taken or vet the home of the father.
Youth A and Youth B were taken to the home of a registered sex
offender and left there for a visit.
Conclusion Violation Established
5

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the current license status be continued.
